title: Brazil Passes Landmark Amazon Protection Law, Bans Commercial Logging
introText: Brazil's Congress has passed the most comprehensive Amazon protection legislation in history, banning commercial logging in primary forests and establishing the world's largest contiguous protected area. Environmental groups hailed the law as a turning point for global climate efforts.

content.content: Brazil enacts historic Amazon protection legislation

The Amazon Forever Act prohibits commercial logging in primary rainforest and creates a continuous protected zone covering 150 million hectares â€“ an area larger than Peru. The law passed with unexpected bipartisan support after intensive lobbying by environmental groups and international pressure.
President signed the bill in a ceremony in Manaus, declaring that 'Brazil will be the guardian of the world's lungs, not its destroyer.'

The law establishes a dedicated 10,000-strong environmental police force with authority to arrest illegal loggers and seize equipment. Satellite monitoring will trigger automatic investigations when deforestation is detected.
Penalties for illegal logging have been increased tenfold, with mandatory prison sentences for large-scale operations. Banks are prohibited from financing businesses linked to deforestation.

The legislation formally recognizes indigenous land rights over 50 million additional hectares, resolving long-standing disputes. Indigenous communities will receive direct payments for forest stewardship through carbon credit revenues.
Indigenous leaders who campaigned for decades welcomed the recognition but vowed to monitor implementation closely.

The government allocated $5 billion for economic transition in affected regions, funding sustainable agriculture, ecotourism, and forest product industries. Workers displaced from logging will receive retraining and income support.
International climate finance of $20 billion has been pledged to support Brazil's conservation efforts, with payments tied to verified deforestation reductions.

summary: Brazil passes historic Amazon protection law, banning commercial logging and creating the world's largest protected area to safeguard the rainforest.
